tlp_fine_tune module

class tlp_fine_tune.AttentionModule[source]

Bases: Module

Defines a neural network module with an attention mechanism for encoding input features, processing with residual blocks, and decoding to output.

fea_size

Dimension of input features.

Type:

int

step_size

Number of time steps in input data.

Type:

int

res_block_cnt

Number of residual blocks in the network.

Type:

int

encoder

Encoder section that transforms input features into high-dimensional representations.

Type:

nn.Sequential

attention

Multi-head attention mechanism to capture dependencies between features.

Type:

nn.MultiheadAttention

l_list

Sequence of residual blocks for further feature processing.

Type:

nn.Sequential

decoder

Decoder section that transforms the final representation to the desired output.

Type:

nn.Sequential

forward(batch_datas_steps)[source]

Forward pass of the AttentionModule.

Parameters:

batch_datas_steps (torch.Tensor) – Batched input tensor with dimensions (batch_size, step_size, fea_size).

Returns:

Output tensor after encoding, applying attention, residual blocks, and decoding.

Return type:

torch.Tensor

training: bool
class tlp_fine_tune.LambdaRankLoss(device)[source]

Bases: Module

Defines the LambdaRank loss function, which is commonly used for learning to rank tasks.

device

The device on which calculations are performed.

Type:

torch.device

forward(preds, labels, k=None, eps=1e-10, mu=10.0, sigma=1.0)[source]

Computes the LambdaRank loss between predicted and actual relevance scores.

Parameters:

  • preds (torch.Tensor) – Predicted relevance scores.

  • labels (torch.Tensor) – Actual relevance scores.

  • k (int, optional) – Rank cutoff parameter.

  • eps (float) – Small constant for numerical stability.

  • mu (float) – Hyperparameter for LambdaRank scheme.

  • sigma (float) – Hyperparameter for sigmoid scaling in probability calculation.

Returns:

The computed LambdaRank loss.

Return type:

torch.Tensor

lamdbaRank_scheme(G, D, *args)[source]

Calculates weights for pairs of items based on their relevance scores and positions.

Parameters:

  • G (torch.Tensor) – Gain matrix for relevance scores.

  • D (torch.Tensor) – Discount matrix for positional discounts.

Returns:

Weight matrix based on LambdaRank scheme.

Return type:

torch.Tensor

training: bool
class tlp_fine_tune.SegmentDataLoader(dataset, batch_size, shuffle)[source]

Bases: object

Custom data loader for segmented data with variable batch sizes and shuffling options.

shuffle

Whether to shuffle the data on each iteration.

Type:

bool

batch_size

Number of samples in each batch.

Type:

int

datas_steps

Tensor of data sequences (steps) to be used in training/validation.

Type:

torch.Tensor

labels

Tensor of labels corresponding to the data steps.

Type:

torch.Tensor

tlp_fine_tune.load_datas(datasets_global)[source]

Splits the dataset into training and validation sets, and initializes data loaders for both.

Parameters:

datasets_global (list) – List of all data samples to be used in training and validation.

Returns:

Tuple containing training and validation data loaders.

Return type:

tuple

tlp_fine_tune.set_seed(seed)[source]

Sets random seed for reproducibility across numpy, Python, and PyTorch libraries.

Parameters:

seed (int) – The seed value to set.

tlp_fine_tune.train(train_loader, val_dataloader, device)[source]

Trains the model over multiple epochs and saves the model at the end of each epoch.

Parameters:

  • train_loader (SegmentDataLoader) – Data loader for the training set.

  • val_dataloader (SegmentDataLoader) – Data loader for the validation set.

  • device (torch.device) – The device on which the model and data are loaded.

tlp_fine_tune.validate(model, valid_loader, loss_func, device)[source]

Evaluates the model on the validation set and computes the total validation loss.

Parameters:

  • model (nn.Module) – The model to be validated.

  • valid_loader (SegmentDataLoader) – Data loader for the validation set.

  • loss_func (nn.Module) – Loss function to use for validation.

  • device (torch.device) – The device on which the model and data are loaded.

Returns:

Total validation loss.

Return type:

float
